exerciseLib.label: Bench Press
exerciseLib.description: lay on bench, push bar w weights up and down, billy

exerciseLib.label: Jumping Jacks
exerciseLib.description: jump up and down and clap hands, billy

exerciseLib.label: Walking
exerciseLib.description: put one foot in front of the other, billy

workoutList.label: Barbell Snatch Grip Deadlift
steps: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with your toes pointed slightly outward.
Place a barbell on the floor in front of you, with the weight plates on either side. Make sure that the bar is directly in line with your feet.
Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands much wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.
Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.
Slowly lower the barbell back to the ground, making sure to keep your back straight and your shoulders down throughout the movement.

workoutList.label: Kettlebell Preacher Curl
steps: Stand behind a bench, with your chest leaning over the edge of the bench.
With one arm resting on the bench, hold the kettlebell, bending the arm at the elbow.
Lower your arm using the bench as a guide, keeping your forearm straight.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

workoutList.label: Biceps Stretch Variation Four
steps: Stand an arms width away from the wall.
Raise your arms out behind you, and place them on the wall with your fingers pointing up.
Bend your knees whilst keeping your hands in the same position.

workoutList.label: Kettlebell Concentration Curl
steps: Sitting on a chair with your legs apart, rest your arm against your thigh and hold the kettlebell with your arm extended towards the floor.
Bending your arm at the elbow, lift the kettlebell until your palm faces your shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.

workoutList.label: Corpe Pose
steps: Lie down on your back with your legs straight and arms at your sides.
Close your eyes and take deep breaths in through your nose and out through your mouth.
Allow your body to completely relax and let go of any tension.
Hold for several minutes and then slowly come back up to a seated position.

workoutList.label: Kettlebell Preacher Curl
steps: Stand behind a bench, with your chest leaning over the edge of the bench.
With one arm resting on the bench, hold the kettlebell, bending the arm at the elbow.
Lower your arm using the bench as a guide, keeping your forearm straight.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Curl
steps: While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly bring the weight back down to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Curl
steps: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length.
Raise one dumbbell and twist your forearm until it is vertical and your palm faces the shoulder.
Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
steps: Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling).
Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height
Return to starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Goblet Curl
steps: Stand up straight with a kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis.
Raise the kettlebell bending your arms at the elbow until the kettlebell is level with your chest.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Concentration Curl
steps: Sitting on a chair with your legs apart, rest your arm against your thigh and hold the kettlebell with your arm extended towards the floor.
Bending your arm at the elbow, lift the kettlebell until your palm faces your shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Preacher Curl
steps: Stand behind a bench, with your chest leaning over the edge of the bench.
With one arm resting on the bench, hold the kettlebell, bending the arm at the elbow.
Lower your arm using the bench as a guide, keeping your forearm straight.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Single Arm Curl
steps: Stand up straight with a kettlebell in one hand with your forearm facing out.
Raise the kettlebell, bending your arm at the elbow and keeping your forearm vertical until your palm faces the shoulder.
Lower to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Biceps Stretch Variation Five
steps: Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Raise your arms out to your sides, bringing them up to shoulder level.
Rotate your palms so they are facing the ceiling.
Then, change direction and rotate the arms as much as you can.

muscleWikiDB.label: Biceps Stretch Variation Four
steps: Stand an arms width away from the wall.
Raise your arms out behind you, and place them on the wall with your fingers pointing up.
Bend your knees whilst keeping your hands in the same position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Biceps Stretch Variation Three
steps: Bend your arm at the elbow, raising your hand to your shoulder.
Using your other hand, stretch the arm down to its full extent.

muscleWikiDB.label: Biceps Stretch Variation Two
steps: Stand facing the wall, an arm's width away.
Place your hand on the wall with your fingers pointing down.
Lean slightly into the wall to feel the stretch in your bicep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Biceps Stretch Variation One
steps: Stand one foot in front of the other with the wall to your right, an arms width away.
Place your hand on the wall, fingers pointing away from you.
Gently lean forward, keeping your hand stationary.
Repeat with the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Twisting Curl
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Start with a neutral grip. Flex at the elbow. While flexing twist your palm. When you hit the top of the movement your palm should be facing upward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Bayesian Curl
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine.
Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support. Face your palm forward. Flex at the elbow and extend.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Reverse Curl
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Face your palm downwards. Flex at the elbow and extend.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Hammer Curl
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cable should be set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Face away from the cable machine. Stagger your stance so you have a better base of support.
Use a neutral grip thumb facing up pinky-facing down). Flex at the elbow and extend.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Bayesian Curl
steps: Attach band to a low anchor point. Point your palms straight forward.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Bayesian Hammer Curl
steps: Attach band to a low anchor point. Use a neutral grip.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Bayesian Reverse Curl
steps: Attach band to a low anchor point. . Point your palms toward your thighs.
Flex your elbow until you feel your biceps contract. Then fully extend elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Reverse Curl
steps: Grab the dumbbells with a pronated (overhand) grip. You can do this exercise thumbless if it's more comfortable on your wrists.
Flex at the elbows until your biceps touch your forearms. Try not to let your elbows flair outward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Reverse Curl
steps: Take a double overhand grip that's about shoulder width. Flex your elbows while keeping your elbows tucked in. Try not to let them flare out.
Curl until your forearm presses into your bicep. Then fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Incline Hammer Curl
steps: Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (thumbs facing the ceiling). Seated on an incline bench.
Slowly lift the dumbbell up to chest height
Return to starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Incline Reverse Curl
steps: Lay on an incline bench.
Grab the dumbbells with a pronated (overhand) grip. You can do this exercise thumbless if it's more comfortable on your wrists.
Flex at the elbows until your biceps touch your forearms. Try not to let your elbows flair outward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Incline Zottman Curl
steps: Lay on an incline bench with your palms facing forward.
Flex at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps.
When you hit the top of the movement, rotate your palms and then lower the dumbbells slowly.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Preacher Curl
steps: Start with a with a dumbbell in one hand and your elbow resting on the bench.
From this starting position, curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary on the bench.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Spider Curl
steps: Lay on an incline or preacher curl bench.
Let your arms hang freely off the edge of the bench.
Fully flex your elbow and fully extend your elbow on each rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Spider Curl
steps: Start by placing your forearms on a flat bench and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
From this starting position, curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body and your core engaged.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Twisting Curl
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Bring the dumbbells to your sides, with your palms facing inward and your elbows bent.
From this starting position, curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders while rotating your wrists so that your palms face your shoulders at the top of the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Curl To Overhead Press
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward.
Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body.
Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms.
Lower the plate back to the starting position, keeping control of it, and repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Curl To Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward.
Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body.
Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms.
Lower the plate back behind the head to the starting position of a tricep extension.
Push the plate back up overhead, then lower it back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat Hold Curl
steps: Lower into a squat position, keeping the plate at chest height.
Slowly curl the plate towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Hold for a moment at the top of the curl before lowering the plate back to chest height.
Repeat the curls as you hold the squat position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band High Curl
steps: Anchor a band to a high point.
Start with your feet staggered and your elbows high.
Flex your elbows while keeping your arms high. Curl the band to your forehead.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band High Hammer Curl
steps: Start with the band anchored to something high with your feet staggered and a neutral grip.
Keep your elbows high. Curl until your fists are at your forehead.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band High Reverse Curl
steps: Start with a band attached to a high point, your feet staggered, and an overhand grip.
Flex your elbows pulling your forearms to your biceps. Your fists should land by your forehead.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Curl
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the band under both feet.
Grasp the handles of the band with both hands, keeping your arms straight and extended in front of you.
Keep your back straight, abs engaged, and shoulders relaxed as you curl your hands towards your shoulders, bending at the elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Reverse Curl
steps: Start by standing on the center of the band with both feet, shoulder-width apart.
Hold the band with both hands, palms facing down, arms extended straight in front of you.
Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders, pulling the band tight, then lower your arms back to the starting position, keeping tension on the band throughout the exercise.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
steps: Sit on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
Lean forward and place your elbow on the inside of your leg.
Curl the dumbbell while keeping your elbow against your leg. Make sure to fully extend your elbow on each rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Curl
steps: Hold the TRX straps with an underhand grip and lean back and away from the anchor point.
Keep your elbows high as you flex your elbows. Pull your fists toward your forehead.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Hammer Curl
steps: Grab the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point.
Maintain a neutral grip. Flex your elbows and pull your fists to either sides of your temples.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Reverse Curl
steps: Stand facing the TRX straps and grasp the handles with both hands, palms facing away from your body.
Walk back until the straps are taut, keeping your arms straight.
Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Landmine Row
steps: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

muscleWikiDB.label: Chin Ups
steps: Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you)
With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar.
Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Kneeling Single Arm Pulldown
steps: Place the band at about eye level. Fall into a kneeling position.
The knee that is on the ground should be the same side as the working arm. Stick your chest out.
And then pull your elbow straight back. Flex your lats and then extend into the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Long Landmine Row
steps: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Meadows Row
steps: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing sideways with a staggered stance and your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.
*Named after the late John Meadows

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Pronated Pendlay Row
steps: Start hinged forward with a flat back and the plates resting on the floor. Make sure your elbows are fully extended.
Pull the bar to your sternum.
Return the plates back to the floor and let the bar come to a full dead stop.
Then initiate the next rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Pronated Row
steps: Grab the barbell with an overhand grip. Hinge forward while keeping your back flat until your torso is about parallel with the ground.
Let your arms hang freely.
Pull the bar to your torso while tucking your elbows in slightly.
Extend your elbows fully before initiating the next rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Supinated Pendlay Row
steps: Begin by standing in front of a barbell with your feet about hip-width apart and your palms facing towards your body.
Bend at the hips and knees to grab the barbell with a pronated (overhand) grip, positioning the barbell about an inch away from your shins.
Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, use your back muscles to lift the barbell straight up towards your chest.
As the barbell reaches your chest, rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing towards your body (supinated grip), and then lower the barbell back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Supinated Row
steps: Begin by standing in front of a barbell with your feet about hip-width apart.
Bend at the hips and knees to grab the barbell with a supinated (underhand) grip, positioning the barbell about an inch away from your shins.
Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, use your back muscles to lift the barbell straight up towards your chest.
As the barbell reaches your chest, pause briefly, and then lower the barbell back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Alternating Pendlay Row
steps: The dumbbells should be set on the ground. Hinge forward while keeping a flat back.
Pull one elbow back toward the ceiling and then return the dumbbell to the ground softly.
Then pull with the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Kneeling Single Arm Row
steps: Place one hand and one knee on a bench. Make sure you keep a flat back.
Pull the dumbbell toward the ceiling.
Make sure to avoid any jerking or rotating.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Laying Incline Row
steps: Lay on an incline bench that is between 30-45 degrees high.
Let your arms hang freely. Pull your elbows straight back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Pendlay Row
steps: The dumbbells should be placed on the floor.
Hinge forward with a flat back and grab the dumbbells.
Pull both dumbbells back and your elbows toward the ceiling.
Return the dumbbells back to the floor softly on each rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Row
steps: Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.
Start by standing in front of a flat bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Place your other hand on the bench for support, and bend at the waist so that your chest is parallel to the ground.
From this starting position, row the dumbbell up towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blade together as you do so.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Row Knee
steps: Start by placing your elbow on one knee.
Hold a dumbbell in your other hand, with your palm facing inwards towards your body.
From this starting position, row the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Pinch Grip Row
steps: Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.
Bend forward at your hips while maintaining a flat back.
Pull the plate toward your upper abdomen.
Lower the weight in a controlled manner and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Lawnmower Row
steps: Stand with feet staggered and one hand on a bench/box. Hold a dumbbell in the opposing hand.
Hinge forward at the hips, keeping the back flat, and eyes facing forward. The weight should hang directly below the shoulders.
Start with an overhand grip, as you pull rotate the dumbbell. When your upper arm reaches your side your palm should be facing forward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Knee Lawnmower Row
steps: Stand with feet staggered and one hand on your knee. Hold a dumbbell in the opposing hand.
Hinge forward at the hips, keeping the back flat, and eyes facing forward. The weight should hang directly below the shoulders.
Start with an overhand grip, as you pull rotate the dumbbell. When your upper arm reaches your side your palm should be facing forward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Supinated Row
steps: Grab both dumbbells and hinge forward at the hips. Make sure you keep a flat back.
The closer your torso is to parallel with the ground the longer the range of motion will be at your shoulder. The better the results you'll get from the exercise.
Let your arms hang freely, maintain an underhand grip, and then pull your elbow joint straight back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Rotating Row
steps: Grab the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the strap is taut.
Start with an overhand grip. Pull your elbows back and rotate your grip.
By the time your elbows reach your side, your palms should be facing upwards.

muscleWikiDB.label: Corpe Pose
steps: Lie down on your back with your legs straight and arms at your sides.
Close your eyes and take deep breaths in through your nose and out through your mouth.
Allow your body to completely relax and let go of any tension.
Hold for several minutes and then slowly come back up to a seated position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Crow Pose
steps: Begin in a squatting position with your feet together and your knees apart.
Place your hands on the floor in front of you, shoulder-width apart. Keep your arms straight and engage your core.
Slowly shift your weight forward and lift your feet off the ground, coming onto your tiptoes.
Bend your elbows and lean your weight onto your hands, shifting your knees towards your upper arms.
Gently lift one foot off the ground, and then the other, balancing on your hands. Hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing back to the ground.

muscleWikiDB.label: Downward Dog
steps: Begin on your hands and knees with your hands shoulder-width apart and your knees hip-width apart.
Spread your fingers wide and press down into your palms, making sure that your fingers are evenly spaced and facing forward.
Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground, straightening your legs as much as possible.
Press your hips up and back, bringing your body into an inverted "V" shape.
Keep your arms straight and your shoulder blades spread apart, and try to press your heels down towards the ground.
Hold the pose for several breaths, then release and return to your starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Downward Dog With Fingers Facing Feet
steps: Begin in the same starting position as the previous exercise, with your hands and knees on the ground.
Spread your fingers wide and turn your hands so that your fingers are facing towards your feet.
Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground, straightening your legs as much as possible.
Press your hips up and back, bringing your body into an inverted "V" shape.
Keep your arms straight and your shoulder blades spread apart, and try to press your heels down towards the ground.
Hold the pose for several breaths, then release and return to your starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Scorpion Twist Pose
steps: Begin in a downward-facing dog pose.
Slowly lift one leg up towards the ceiling, keeping your hips level and your toes pointed.
Bend your lifted leg and try to touch your toes to the back of your head.
Once you have a firm grip with your toes, slowly begin to twist your torso towards the lifted leg.
Keep your hands and feet firmly planted on the ground as you hold the pose for a few breaths. Release the pose and repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Seated Arm Stretch
steps: Sit cross-legged on the floor.
Extend your arms straight out in front of you, palms facing forward.
Cross your right arm over your left arm and interlace your fingers.
Pull your hands away from your body and hold for a few breaths, then release and repeat with the opposite arm on top.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Bench Press
steps: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar.
Lower the bar to your mid chest
Raise the bar until you've locked your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dips
steps: Hold your body with arms locked above the equipment
Lower your body slowly while leaning forward, flare out your elbows
Raise your body above the bars until your arms are locked.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
steps: Raise the bench to a 30 - 45 degree angle
Lay on the bench and set your feet on the ground.
Raise the dumbbells with straight arms then slowly lower them to about shoulder width.
Raise them again until your arms are locked and at the starting position again.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Incline Chest Flys
steps: Lay flat on the bench and place your feet on the ground.
Begin the exercise with the dumbbells held together above your chest, elbows slightly bent.
Simultaneously lower the weights to either side.
Pause when the weights are parallel to the bench, then raise your arms to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Bench Press
steps: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. Raise the dumbbells until you have straight arms.
Lower the dumbbells to your mid chest
Raise the dumbbells until you've locked your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Incline Bench Press
steps: Position the bench between 30 and 45 degrees.
Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With straight arms unrack the bar.
Lower the bar to your mid chest
Raise the bar (slowly and controlled) until you've locked your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Chest Press
steps: Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, hold the kettlebell at your chest with both hands.
Fully extend your arms, raising the kettlebell until your elbows are locked.
Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Single Arm Chest Fly
steps: Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, with your arms to the side of your body.
Holding a kettlebell in one hand, keeping your arm fully extended with a slight bend in the elbow and your forearms facing upwards, lift the kettlebell above your chest.
Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Single Arm Press
steps: Laying on the floor with your knees bent and feet firmly on the floor, leave one arm resting to the side of the body.
Using the other arm, hold the kettlebell at arms length directly upwards of your shoulder.
Lower your arm until your upper arm to elbow is resting on the floor.
Return to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Walkover Pushup
steps: Starting in a press up position with feet wide and one hand resting on the kettlebell, complete a full press up, lowering your chest towards the ground while keeping your body straight and returning to the starting position.
Swap hands on the kettlebell, placing the hand originally on the kettlebell underneath your shoulder, complete another press up.
Repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Chest Stretch Variation Four
steps: Raise your arms to shoulder height, fully extended in front of you.
Slowly bring your arms behind your back still at shoulder height.
Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Chest Stretch Variation Three
steps: Place your arms behind your back and clasp your hands together.
Slowly extend your elbows until they are locked then lift them away from you.
Pause in this position for a few seconds and then return them to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Chest Stretch Variation Two
steps: Lay on your side with one hand just in front of you.
With a slight bend in your arm, rotate your arm around your body as slowly as possible.
Return to the starting position and then repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Chest Stretch Variation One
steps: Using a raised wall, place your arm at a 90 degree angle against it.
With a staggered stance, lean into the wall extending your chest.
Pause for a few seconds and then return to starting position and repeat on opposite side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Push Up
steps: Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders.
Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body
Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body
Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Incline Push Up
steps: Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform.
Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the bench.
Push body up until arms are extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Decline Push Up
steps: Use a bench to elevate your feet.
Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground
Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Pec Fly
steps: Use a handle attachment set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover.
Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward. From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Chest Press
steps: Use a handle attachment. The cables should be set to shoulder height.
Bring both of the handles to your chest and make sure you are in the center of the cable crossover.
Walk a few steps forward. Then press the weight forward.
From there, you should flex and extend at both the shoulders and elbows simultaneously.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Single Arm Pec Fly
steps: Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Extend your shoulder joint and bring your arm across your body until you feel a contraction in your pecs.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Single Arm Chest Press
steps: Attach the band to an anchor point that is about shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Extend your shoulder joint and elbow across your body until your arm is fully extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Pushup
steps: Loop the band around your mid-back. The ends of the bands should be around your hands between your thumb and pointer finger.
This exercise can be done from the knees or the toes depending on experience level.
Begin by breaking at the elbows until your upper arm is by your side. Then extend at the elbows back into the top position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Floor Press
steps: Un-rack the bar and break at the elbows and shoulders.
Bring your elbows to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Hooklying Bench Press
steps: Start in a bench press position with your feet planted on the bench and knees bent.
Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Larsen Bench Press
steps: Start in a bench press position with your legs elevated. Try to keep your knees with a slight bend in them.
Unrack the bar then initiate the rep.
Bring the bar to your torso and tap your ribcage before pressing back to the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Spoto Press
steps: Start on the bench with your shoulder blades pulled back.
As you initiate the first rep, tuck your elbows slightly until the bar is a few inches off your chest.
Pause just off your chest for 1-3 seconds. Then press explosively.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Bench Press
steps: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. Raise the dumbbells until you have straight arms.
Lower the dumbbells to your mid chest
Raise the dumbbells until you've locked your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Chest Fly
steps: Lay on a bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you.
You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement.
Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body.
Bring the dumbbells back together at the top.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Alternating Single Arm Press
steps: Lay on a decline bench with both arms extended in front of you.
Break at one of your arms first bringing that arm to your side while keeping the other arm extended.
Press the dumbbell back to the ceiling. Fully extend that arm before initiating on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
steps: Lay on a decline bench with both arms extended in front of you.
Break at the elbows and bring your upper arms to your side.
Once your upper arms have reached your side, press the dumbbells back to the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Chest Fly
steps: Lay flat on a decline bench press with the dumbbells pointed toward the ceiling.
Maintain a slight bend in your elbows. Bring the dumbbells out to the side, stopping the dumbbells before they pass your torso.
Bring the dumbbells together to finish the rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Guillotine Bench Press
steps: Lie on the decline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.
Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Neutral Bench Press
steps: Lie on the decline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.
This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Single Arm Bench Press
steps: Start by laying on a decline bench with two dumbbells.
Position the dumbbell above your chest with your elbow bent and shoulder level.
Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged while the other dumbbell remains pointed toward the ceiling.
Once the dumbbell reaches your side, pause for a moment and then press the weight back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Squeeze Press
steps: Lay flat on a decline bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another.
Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest.
Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Guillotine Bench Press
steps: Lie on the flat bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.
Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Guillotine Incline Bench Press
steps: Lie on the incline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.
Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
steps: Raise the bench to a 30 - 45 degree angle
Lay on the bench and set your feet on the ground.
Raise the dumbbells with straight arms then slowly lower them to about shoulder width.
Raise them again until your arms are locked and at the starting position again.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Incline Chest Fly
steps: Lay on an incline bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you.
You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement.
Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body.
Bring the dumbbells back together at the top.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Internally Rotated Chest Fly
steps: Lay on a bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you in an overhand grip.
You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement.
Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body.
Bring the dumbbells back together at the top.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Internally Rotated Incline Chest Fly
steps: Lay on an incline bench with two dumbbells extended in front of you.
You should have a slight bend in your elbows and maintain that bend. Your shoulder joint should do all the movement. You should have an overhand grip.
Bring the dumbbells out to your side. Stop the dumbbells before going behind your body.
Bring the dumbbells back together at the top.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Bench Press
steps: Lie on a flat bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.
This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Incline Bench Press
steps: Lie on an incline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.
This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Squeeze Press
steps: Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another.
Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest.
Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Press
steps: Start by laying on a bench with two dumbbells.
Position the dumbbell above your chest with your elbow bent and shoulder level.
Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged while the other dumbbell remains pointed toward the ceiling.
Once the dumbbell reaches your side, pause for a moment and then press the weight back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Burpee
steps: Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you.
Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes.
Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body.
Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead.
Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Chest Fly
steps: Secure two resistance bands to a sturdy anchor point (e.g. a door anchor, a post, etc.) at chest height.
Stand facing away from the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart and hold each end of the band in each hand.
Start with arms fully extended and parallel to the floor.
Keeping arms straight, slowly bring your arms together in front of your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Chest Press
steps: Stand in the middle of the two bands with feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with one foot to create tension in the bands.

Hold one band in each hand, palms facing forward.
Start the exercise with your arms extended in front of you, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
Lower your arms to the sides of your chest, maintaining control of the band.
Push your arms back up to the starting position, keeping your core engaged and maintaining control of the band.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Internally Rotated Chest Fly
steps: Start with both feet hip-width apart and step on the middle of the band with both feet. Hold the handles of the band in each hand and position the band above your chest, with your palms facing down.

Keeping your elbows slightly bent, slowly raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel with the floor. Make sure to internally rotate your shoulder joints by bringing your shoulder blades together and rotating your forearms inward towards your torso.
Hold the position for a few seconds and then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position, keeping the internal rotation of your shoulder joints throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Deficit Pushup
steps: Start in a pushup position with both hands on a plate. This will extend your range of motion.
Break at the elbows and shoulders until your upper arm travels behind the body slightly.
Then press back into the original position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Glute Bridge to Chest Press
steps: Lay flat on the ground with a plate on your chest.
Push your hips up toward the ceiling and maintain that extended position.
With your hips up, press the plate toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Elevated Pushup
steps: Start by placing two dumbbells on the floor, about shoulder-width apart.
Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the dumbbells, keeping your arms straight.
Keep your feet together, with your toes resting on the floor.
Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the dumbbells.
Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.

muscleWikiDB.label: Pushup to Renegade Row
steps: Start in a high plank position with a pair of dumbbells positioned under your shoulders. Your hands should grip the dumbbells, palms facing each other.
Keep your core engaged and your back straight as you row one dumbbell up towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.
Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Pec Fly
steps: Start by adjusting the TRX straps to chest height. Stand facing the TRX with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears.
Lean forward, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. Your body should form a slight diagonal line from your ankles to your head.
Slowly bring your arms towards each other, in front of your chest, while keeping your core engaged and your body in a stable position.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Pushup
steps: Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them.
Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders.
Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line.
Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Alternating Single Arm Press
steps: Start in a bench press position with two dumbbells.
Break at one of your elbows first while keeping the other elbow extended.
Your working arm should reach your side before pressing back to the ceiling.
Then alternate to the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Bow Pose
steps: Lie on your stomach with your arms at your sides.
Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks.
Reach back with your hands and grab your ankles.
Inhale and lift your chest off the ground, pulling your legs up and back with your hands.
Keep your gaze forward and hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing back to the ground.

muscleWikiDB.label: Yogi Arm Clock
steps: Stand facing a wall with your arms extended and your palms pressing into the wall at shoulder height.
Slowly begin to walk your feet away from the wall, keeping your arms straight and your hands pressing into the wall.
Walk until your arms are fully extended and your body is at a 45-degree angle to the ground.
Repeat From High to Low Angles starting above the shoulder, and ending below the chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Mountain
steps: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
Press your feet into the ground and engage your leg muscles.
Lift your chest and roll your shoulders back and down.
Take a deep breath in, and as you exhale, release any tension in your body and relax your muscles.

muscleWikiDB.label: Tree Pose
steps: Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
Shift your weight onto your left foot and bend your right knee, bringing the sole of your right foot to the inside of your left thigh.
Bring your hands together in front of your heart, or raise them overhead.
Hold the pose for a few breaths, then release and repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Warrior One
steps: Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and turn it slightly inward, while keeping your right foot facing forward.
Inhale and raise your arms overhead, then exhale and bend your right knee, bringing it directly over your ankle.
Hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Warrior Two
steps: Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and turn it slightly inward, while keeping your right foot facing forward.
Inhale and raise your arms to shoulder height, parallel to the ground, with your palms facing down.
Exhale and bend your right knee, bringing it directly over your ankle while keeping your left leg straight.
Look over your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Supported Matsyasana Pose
steps: Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you.
Place a yoga block behind you, horizontally, at the base of your spine.
Slowly recline over the block, supporting yourself with your forearms, until your back is resting on the block.
Relax your arms at your sides, palms facing up, and breathe deeply.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Squat
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Maintain the natural arch in your back, squeezing your shoulder blades and raising your chest.
Grip the bar across your shoulders and support it on your upper back. Unwrack the bar by straightening your legs, and take a step back.
Bend your knees as you lower the weight without altering the form of your back until your hips are below your knees.
Raise the bar back to starting position, lift with your legs and exhale at the top.

muscleWikiDB.label: Machine Leg Press
steps: Place your legs on the platform with your feet at shoulder width.
Release the weight and extend your legs fully, without locking your knees.
Lower the weight until your legs are at a 90 angle (but DO NOT allow your butt and lower back to rise off of the pad. This will put your lower back in a rounded position, which is very dangerous.)
Raise the weight back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Machine Leg Extension
steps: Sit on the machine with your back against the cushion and adjust the machine you are using so that your knees are at a 90 degree angle at the starting position.
Raise the weight by extending your knees outward, then lower your leg to the starting position. Both movements should be done in a slow, controlled motion.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Squat
steps: Hold the weight tucked into your upper chest area, keeping your elbows in. Your feet should be slightly wider than shoulder width.
Sink down into the squat, keeping your elbows inside the track of your knees.
Push through your heels while keeping your chest up and return to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Bulgarian Split Squat
steps: Stand with your back to a bench (or raised surface) and place one of your feet on the bench.
Squat down until your front leg is about parallel to the floor.
Go back to the starting position. After completing the desired amount of reps, switch legs and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Step Up
steps: Standing up straight, using a bench as a step, raise one foot onto the bench and hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the straight leg.
Stand and bring both feet onto the bench. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
Repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
steps: Hold the weight tucked into your upper chest area, keeping your elbows in. Your feet should be slightly wider than your shoulders.
Sink down into the squat, keeping your elbows inside the track of your knees.
Push through your heels while keeping your chest up and return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Heels Up Goblet Squat
steps: Hold the weight tucked into your upper chest area, keeping your elbows in. Your feet should be slightly wider than your shoulders and the heels slightly raised on a surface.
Sink down into the squat, keeping your elbows inside the track of your knees.
Push through your heels while keeping your chest up and return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Reverse Lunge
steps: Stand straight with your feet slightly apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand.
Bring the same leg as the arm holding the kettlebell behind you, squat down until your back knee touches the ground, keeping your back straight.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Forward Lunge
steps: Stand straight with your feet slightly apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand.
Bring the same leg as the arm holding the kettlebell in front of you, squat down until your thigh is parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Lateral Lunge
steps: Stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart. Keep your back straight and hold the kettlebell in front of your pelvis.
Take a large step to one side, holding the kettlebell low and lunge into the bent leg.
Return to the starting position and repeat

muscleWikiDB.label: Quads Stretch Variation Four
steps: Lay flat on your belly. Extend one arm out in front of you, placing your palm on the floor. With your other arm, grab the top of your foot.
Keeping your upper leg flat on the floor, pull your foot towards your buttocks to engage the stretch.
Pause for a few seconds, and then repeat the stretch with your other leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: Quads Stretch Variation Three
steps: Lay flat on your belly, with both hands reach back and grab the tops of your feet.
Keeping your upper legs flat on the ground, pull both of your feet towards your buttocks.
Pause at the apex of the stretch, then return to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Quads Stretch Variation Two
steps: Place one foot flat on the ground in front of you at a 90 degree angle. With your other leg, balance upon your knee, placing the tip of your foot against the wall behind you for balance.
Place your hands on your knee in front of you, and lean forward so that your knee extends over your foot.
Pause at the apex of the stretch, and slowly return to starting position. Repeat with your other leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: Quads Stretch Variation One
steps: Stand perpendicular to a wall, using one arm against the wall for balance. With your other arm, grab the top of your foot.
Pull your leg upwards and back to engage your quads, pausing at the apex of the stretch for a few seconds.
Return to starting position and repeat with your other leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: Side Lunges
steps: Take a slow, lateral step to the right.
Extend the left knee, and drive your weight into your right side.
Flex your knee and lower your body.
Push back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Forward Lunges
steps: Step forward with one leg.
Lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the ground.
Ensure you remain upright, and your front knee stay above the front foot.
Push off the floor with your front foot until you return to the starting position. Switch legs.

muscleWikiDB.label: Jump Squats
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Start by doing a regular squat, then engage your core and jump up explosively.
When you land, lower your body back into the squat position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Bodyweight Squat
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart.
flex your knees and hips and sit back into the squat while lowering your body
Continue down to full depth
Return to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Curtsy Lunge
steps: Place the barbell on your back
Step your foot back and around while simultaneously bringing the weight down.
Return to start and repeat on other leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Goblet Squat
steps: Start with a straight bar or easy bar attachment .
Get your elbows directly underneath the bar, squat straight up and then walk back a few steps.
Break at your knees and hips to initiate the squat. Make sure you maintain a flat back.
Squat all the way back to a standing position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Split Squat
steps: You can use any attachment on this exercise. Cable should be set all to the bottom.
Grab the attachment and walk back a few steps. Take a split stance. One leg in front and one behind.
Break at the knees and hips to initiate the split squat. Make sure your back knee touches the floor.
Squat back up into a standing position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Standing Leg Extension
steps: Stand upright facing away from the cable crossover with the cable set to the height of your hips. Use an ankle/wrist attachment.
Extend at the knee against the cable.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Leg Press
steps: Lay flat on the ground with your head by the anchor point of the band, which should be 6 to 12 inches above your head
Place the band around your midfoot and extend at the knees and hip.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Squat
steps: Stand with a shoulder width grip. Both feet should be on the band with the band loops in each of your hand.
Push your butt back and also break at the knees.
Try to hit parallel depth (bottom of your leg should be parallel with the ground). If you can't tell your squat depth, then try squatting in front of a mirror and watch your form.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Bulgarian Split Squat
steps: Holding the dumbbell in a goblet squat place your foot on a bench or box.
Break at the hips and knees. Try to go to the point where your hamstring is parallel with the ground. Or until your back knee taps the floor.
Make sure to keep your back flat and your elbows directly under your fists.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat
steps: Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement).
You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously.
Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower.
The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Front Squat Olympic
steps: Measure your hands by the markings on the bar to make sure you're even. Then throw your elbows underneath the bar.
The bar should be set so high on your shoulders it digs into your neck a bit. Make sure to push your elbows up to the ceiling for the entire rep. To make sure you don't get too pitched forward.
Use the squat stance you would use for a back or goblet squat. Push your hips back to initiate the squat. Break at the knees until you hit parallel depth.
Squat back up to a standing position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Front Squat Bodybuilding
steps: Measure your shoulders against the bar to make sure you're even. Throw your shoulders under the bar. The bar should be digging into your neck slightly.
Make sure to push your elbows up to the ceiling for the entire rep. To make sure you don't get too pitched forward.
Use the squat stance you would use for a back or goblet squat. Push your hips back to initiate the squat. Break at the knees until you hit parallel depth.
Squat back up to a standing position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell High Bar Squat
steps: Place the bar on top of your traps.
Push your hips back and break at the knees. Push your elbows forward to keep yourself from getting pitched too far forward.
Aim to get your hamstrings to parallel with the floor.
Push your heels into the floor and squat back to a standing position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Low Bar Squat
steps: Pull your shoulder blades back really hard and place the bar on your posterior delts.
Push your hips back and break at the knees to initiate the squat.
Aim to get your hamstrings to parallel with the ground. Push your heels into the floor and squat back up to a standing position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
steps: Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement).
You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously.
Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower.
The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Coan Deadlift
steps: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a barbell on the floor in front of you.
Bend at the hips and knees to grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands just outside of your hips.
Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, lift the barbell off the floor by extending your hips and knees.
As you lift the barbell, pull your shoulders back and squeeze your glutes to fully extend your hips at the top of the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Forward Lunge
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at your shoulders with an overhand grip.
Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
Push off your right foot to return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Front Rack Step Up
steps: Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at your shoulders with an overhand grip.
Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench.
Bring your left foot up onto the bench and stand up straight, keeping the barbell at your shoulders.
Step back down with your left foot, followed by your right foot, to return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Heels Up Back Squat
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your heels on a plate or low step.
Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Heels Up Front Squat
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and feet on a plate. Place the bar in a front rack position.
Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position, keeping your heels raised off the ground.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Lateral Lunge
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at your shoulders with an overhand grip.
Step out to the side with your right foot and bend your right knee to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
Push off your right foot to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Pause Box Squat
steps: Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell resting on your upper back.
Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up.
Push through your heels to return to the standing position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Pause Squat
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell resting on your upper back.
Lower your body into a squat position, pausing for a moment at the bottom of the movement before standing back up.
Push through your heels to return to the standing position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Reverse Deadlift
steps: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with your toes pointed slightly outward.
Place a barbell on the floor behind you, with the weight plates on either side.
Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.
Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Reverse Lunge
steps: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with a barbell on your shoulders. Your feet should be slightly pointed outward, and your shoulders should be down and relaxed.
Step backward with one foot, lowering your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground and your back knee is hovering just above the ground.
Push off your back foot, returning to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Bodyweight Reverse Step Up
steps: Start with a box or bench behind you and one of your feet on the box/bench.
The balls of your feet should be planted on the box/bench.
Drive through the ball of your foot extending your knees until you're upright and standing on the box.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Side Step Up
steps: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with a barbell on your shoulders. Your feet should be slightly pointed outward, and your shoulders should be down and relaxed.
Place a step or box beside you, and step up onto it with one foot. Your other foot should remain on the ground.
Push off your grounded foot, raising your body up onto the step.
Step back down with the same foot, returning to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Split Squat
steps: Take a large step forward with one leg, and lower your body until your back knee nearly touches the ground. Your front knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle, and your back leg should be straight.
Push through the heel of your front foot to raise your body back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Step Up Balance
steps: Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height, holding a barbell across your upper back and shoulders, using an overhand grip.
Place your right foot on the box and push through the heel to lift your body up and onto the box, keeping your left foot off the ground.
Step back down with your right foot, lowering your left foot to the ground.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Step Up
steps: Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height, holding a barbell across your upper back and shoulders, using an overhand grip.
Place your right foot on the box and push through the heel to lift your body up and onto the box.
Step back down with your right foot.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Tap Pause Squat
steps: Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height, holding a barbell across your upper back and shoulders, using an overhand grip.
Sit back and lower your body down until your glutes tap the top of the box, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Push through your heels to extend your hips and stand up, bringing your body back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Zercher Squat
steps: Begin by standing with your feet about hip-width apart and holding a barbell in the crook of your arms, near your belly. Your palms should be facing towards your body.
Sit back and lower your body down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Push through your heels to extend your hips and stand back up to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Assisted Bulgarian Split Squat
steps: Grab a stick of some sort or hold onto something stable (rack, bench).
Grab a box that is knee height or slightly lower.
Hold the stick in your right arm and put your right leg on the box.
Begin your squat by breaking at the knees. Get your knee close to the floor or all the way to the floor. Make sure to keep your chest tall.

muscleWikiDB.label: Bulgarian Split Squat
steps: Stand with your back to a bench (or raised surface) and place one of your feet on the bench.
Squat down until your front leg is about parallel to the floor.
Go back to the starting position. After completing the desired amount of reps, switch legs and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Curtsy Lunge
steps: Step your left foot diagonally behind your right leg, crossing it behind your body. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee is hovering just above the ground.
Push through your right foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position.
Repeat the movement with your other leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: Forward Lunge
steps: Step forward with one leg and lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the floor and your back knee almost touches the ground. Keep your chest up and your front foot flat on the floor.
Push through your front foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position.
Repeat the movement with your other leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: Heels Up Squat
steps: Place your heels on a plate or very low step.
Keep your chest tall and initiate the squat by pushing your hips back and breaking at the knees.
You should notice yourself able to squat lower than normal.

muscleWikiDB.label: Lateral Lunge
steps: Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body.
Take a large step to the side with your right foot, planting it firmly on the ground.
As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight.
Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.

muscleWikiDB.label: Bodyweight Reverse Lunge
steps: Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position.
Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.
Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

muscleWikiDB.label: Split Squat
steps: Take a split stance. Make sure to keep your chest tall.
Bring your rear knee to the floor or close to it.
Drive through your front heel and your rear foot back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
steps: Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement).
You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously.
Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower.
The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Forward Lunge
steps: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other.
Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is hovering just above the floor.
Push through your right heel to straighten your right leg and return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Bulgarian Split Squat
steps: Holding the dumbbell in a goblet squat place your foot on a bench or box.
Break at the hips and knees. Try to go to the point where your hamstring is parallel with the ground. Or until your back knee taps the floor.
Make sure to keep your back flat and your elbows directly under your fists.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Curtsy Lunge
steps: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a dumbbell in a goblet position.
Step your left foot behind and to the right of your right foot, crossing it behind your right leg.
Bend your knees and lower your hips down and back, as if you were about to sit in a chair.
Push through your right heel to straighten your right leg and return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Forward Lunge
steps: Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.
Step forward with one of your legs while bending at your back leg. Bring your back knee to the floor or close to the floor.
Push through your front leg explosively to get back to your starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Lateral Lunge
steps: Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body. Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.
Take a large step to the side with your right foot, planting it firmly on the ground.
As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight.
Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Reverse Lunge
steps: Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.
Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.
Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position.
Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Split Squat
steps: Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.
Take a large step forward with one leg, and lower your body until your back knee nearly touches the ground. Your front knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle, and your back leg should be straight.
Push through the heel of your front foot to raise your body back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Lateral Lunge Reach
steps: Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body. Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.
Take a large step to the side with your right foot and reach toward the floor with your single dumbbell.
As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight.
Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Reverse Lunge
steps: Hold two dumbbells by your side.
Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.
Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position.
Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Split Squat
steps: Hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.
Take a large step forward with one leg, and lower your body until your back knee nearly touches the ground. Your front knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle, and your back leg should be straight.
Push through the heel of your front foot to raise your body back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Front Rack Pause Squat
steps: Place two dumbbells on your shoulders and make sure you force your elbows upward.
Push your hips back and break at the knees.
When you reach parallel (hamstrings parallel with the ground) pause for 1-3 seconds. Then push through your heels back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Front Rack Squat
steps: Place two dumbbells on your shoulders and push your elbows upward.
Push your hips back and break at the knees.
Hit parallel depth and then drive through your heels back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Goblet Pulse Squat
steps: Hold a dumbbell in goblet position.
Squat down to parallel depth and then halfway back up.
Stay in this short range of motion for the duration of the set.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Heels Up Goblet Squat
steps: Take a half kneeling stance. The dumbbell should start over your knee that is up.
Rotate at the spine and point the dumbbell to the opposing side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Heels Up Narrow Goblet Squat
steps: Stand with your feet on a plate. Your feet should be very close to one another, but not touching.
Begin your squat by pushing your hips back and breaking at the knees. Try to keep your chest tall while squatting.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Leg Extension
steps: Place a dumbbell between your feet. Lean back slightly and hold on to the bench.
Extend your knees until you feel your quads contract hard.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Offset Squat
steps: Hold a dumbbell over one shoulder.
Initiate the squat by pushing your hips back.
Avoid doing any twisting. Try to keep your shoulders even.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Sumo Squat
steps: Start by standing with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Place the dumbbells on the ground between your feet.
From this starting position, bend your knees and lower your body down into a squat.
Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Thruster
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Bring the dumbbells to your shoulders, with your palms facing inward and your elbows bent.
From this starting position, dip your knees slightly and then quickly extend them as you press the dumbbells upwards.
As you press the dumbbells upwards, also push your hips forward to help generate additional power.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a weight plate in front of your chest with both hands.
Keep your back straight, lower your body as if you were sitting back into a chair.
Go as low as you can while keeping your heels flat on the ground, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat Reach
steps: Stand holding a weight plate at chest height with both hands.
Lower into a squat, extending the plate in front of you at chest height
As you stand back up, pull the plate back into your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Curtsy Lunge
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso.
Step back and across the body with the right foot, bending both legs to lower into a lunge position.
Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side by stepping back and across with the left foot.
Continue alternating sides for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Lateral Lunge
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart and the plate held in front of the torso.
Take a step to the side with one foot, bending the knee and lowering the hips into a lunge.
Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side by stepping to the other side with the other foot.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Forward Lunge
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart and the plate held in front of the torso.
Take a step forward with one foot, bending the front knee to lower the hips into a lunge.
Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side by stepping forward with the other foot.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Reverse Lunge Twist
steps: Step back with your right foot into a lunge position, both knees bent at 90 degrees.
Twist your torso to the right, keeping the plate close to your chest.
Push through your front foot to return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Reverse Lunge
steps: Hold the plate at chest height close to your body
Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.
Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position.
Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Leg Extension
steps: Anchor a band to something stable and set up a bench.
Run through the band underneath the bench and loop around your feet.
Flex and extend your knees.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Overhead Squat
steps: Hold a weight plate at arm's length overhead, with your arms fully extended. The plate should be directly above your head and your elbows should be locked.
Begin to bend your knees, lowering your body as far as you can while keeping the weight plate overhead. Make sure to keep your back straight and your chest lifted.
