Once your thighs are parallel to the ground or as low as you can go, pause for a moment.
Push through your heels to return to a standing position, keeping the weight plate overhead the entire time.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Deficit Lunge
steps: Stand on a plate with both feet.
Step back with one foot to the floor and let your back knee get close to or tap the floor.
Push through your front leg until both feet are back on the plate.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Overhead Walking Lunge
steps: Stand tall with a plate overhead.
Step with one foot forward bringing your back knee to the floor. Gently tap your knee then drive through your front leg.
Go back to a standing position and then step forward with the opposing legs.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat Hold
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with a weight plate held in both hands at chest height.
Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and your weight in your heels.
Go down until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then pause for a moment.
Hold the squat position for the desired amount of time, keeping the weight plate steady and your core engaged.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Thruster
steps: Start with the plate at chest height. Begin a squat.
Make sure to hit parallel depth. On your way back up, use the momentum you generate with your legs to help push the plate into an overhead position.
Let the plate return to chest height before initiating the next squat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Overhead Squat
steps: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold two dumbbells overhead with both hands, using an overhand grip.
Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead.
Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Single Arm Overhead Squat
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in your right hand, extending it overhead.
Inhale and begin to squat down, keeping the dumbbell overhead and your back straight.
Go down as far as you can while still maintaining control, then exhale and return to standing position, keeping the dumbbell overhead. Repeat for desired reps and then switch to the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Curtsy Lunge
steps: Stand facing away from the anchor point, holding onto the TRX handles with both hands.
Step your left foot behind your right, crossing it behind your right leg, and lower yourself into a curtsy lunge.
Push through your right foot to return to the starting position and repeat the movement with the other leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Jumping Squat
steps: Stand facing the TRX straps and place your feet shoulder-width apart.
Begin by lowering into a squat position by bending at the knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up.
Explosively jump up off the ground, using your arms for momentum if desired.
Land softly back in the squat position, making sure to absorb the impact with your legs.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Lateral Lunge
steps: Grasp the TRX handles with both hands and extend your arms straight in front of you.
Step laterally to one side, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged.
Lower your body into a lunge position, keeping your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your back leg straight.
Push off your front foot to return to the starting position, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Reverse Lunge
steps: Hold on to the TRX straps and step away until the strap is taut.
Step backwards with one leg in to a lunge position and gently tap your knee to the floor.
Lunge back to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Split Squat
steps: Hold the two TRX straps and step away until the straps are taut. Take a split stance.
Bring your back knee to the floor and gently tap the floor.
Use your arms and the TRX to help assist you getting back into the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Squat
steps: Hold the two TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point.
Flex at the hips and knees in to a squat position.
You can use your arms and the straps to assist you back into the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Glute Bridge
steps: Lay flat on the ground with both feet planted. Make sure you keep your heels glued to the floor.
Place the dumbbell on your hips. Push your hips toward the ceiling until you feel your glutes contract.
Then return to the floor.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Sumo Deadlift
steps: Stance width can vary with a sumo DL. Some prefer toes near the plates. Others prefer a more narrow stance to get more drive off the floor.
Make sure your arms are inside your legs. The bar should be just over your mid-foot. Flatten your back and push your heels into the floor.
Try to extend your knees and hips simultaneously.

muscleWikiDB.label: Burpee
steps: Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you.
Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes.
Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body.
Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead.
Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat Hold Reach
steps: Hold the plate with both hands at chest height.
Keeping your core tight and your chest up, squat down as low as you can go while keeping your feet flat on the ground.
Hold the squat position and reach the plate forward, keeping your arms straight and your back straight.
Return the plate to your chest while you hold the squat position and repeat reaching the plate in front of you

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat Hold Curl
steps: Lower into a squat position, keeping the plate at chest height.
Slowly curl the plate towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Hold for a moment at the top of the curl before lowering the plate back to chest height.
Repeat the curls as you hold the squat position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Single Leg Deadlift
steps: Engage your core and straighten your legs to lift the plate off the ground.
Stand on one leg, keeping the other leg off the ground, while holding the plate in front of your body.
Keep your back straight and maintain a neutral head position while looking straight ahead.
Lower the plate back down to the ground while keeping your balance on one leg.

muscleWikiDB.label: Crescent Moon Pose
steps: Begin in Runner's Lunge pose with your right foot forward.
Slowly lift your torso up and bring your arms overhead, palms facing each other.
Make sure your right knee is directly above your ankle, and your left leg is straight behind you.
Hold for a few breaths before repeating on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Crescent Moon Pose Quad Stretch
steps: Begin in Crescent Moon Pose with your right foot forward and a block nearby.
Place the block at the highest height under your left hand.
Reach your left arm behind you and take hold of your left foot or ankle.

Gently pull your foot towards your buttocks while pressing your left hand into the block to deepen the stretch in your left quad. Hold for a few breaths before releasing and repeating on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Crescent Moon Pose Quad Stretch With Block
steps: Begin in Crescent Moon Pose with your right foot forward and a block nearby.
Place the block at the highest height under your left hand.
Reach your left arm behind you and take hold of your left foot or ankle.

Gently pull your foot towards your buttocks while pressing your left hand into the block to deepen the stretch in your left quad. Hold for a few breaths before releasing and repeating on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Lord Of The Dance
steps: Begin by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart.
Shift your weight onto your left foot and bring your right heel towards your glute.
Reach your right arm back and grab onto the inside of your right foot or ankle.
Inhale and lift your right foot away from your glute while extending your left arm forward. Hold for 5-10 breaths before switching sides.

muscleWikiDB.label: Monkey Pose
steps: Begin in a low lunge with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground.
Slowly slide your left knee back while extending your right leg forward, keeping both legs straight.
Lower your body down to the ground, using your hands for support if needed.
Hold the pose for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Monkey Pose With Blocks
steps: Begin in tabletop position, with hands and knees on the ground.
Place yoga blocks shoulder-width apart under your hands.
Shift your hips back towards your heels, while keeping your arms straight.
Hold the pose for several deep breaths, feeling a stretch in your shoulders and upper back. Release the pose and return to tabletop position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Runners Lunge
steps: Begin in Downward Facing Dog pose (Adho Mukha Svanasana).
Step your right foot forward between your hands.
Place your left knee on the ground behind you and slide it back until you feel a stretch in your left hip flexor.
Keep your hands on the ground or lift them to the sky and hold for a few breaths before repeating on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Chair Pose
steps: Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
Inhale and raise your arms straight up over your head.
Exhale and bend your knees, lowering your hips as if you were sitting in a chair.
Hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and stand up straight.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Seated Shrug
steps: Sit on a bench with dumbbells in both hands, palms facing your body, back straight.
Elevate your shoulders and hold the contracted position at the apex of the motion.
Slowly lower your shoulders back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Smith Machine Standing Shrugs
steps: Place the bar on a lower rung so that when gripped your arms are fully extended and your back is straight.
Grip at shoulder width, raise the bar with your shoulders and pause at the contracted position.
Slowly lower the bar back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Shrug
steps: Standing up straight with feet shoulder width apart.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis, engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.
Release the shrug and repeat

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Upright Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Silverback Shrug
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.

muscleWikiDB.label: Traps Stretch Variation Three
steps: Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Nod your head forward, bringing your chin to your chest.
You will feel the stretch across your neck.

muscleWikiDB.label: Traps Stretch Variation Two
steps: Keeping your chest facing forward, turn your head 90 degrees to the left. Then return to centre point.
Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Repeat, turning your head in the other direction.

muscleWikiDB.label: Traps Stretch Variation One
steps: Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
Place your left hand on your head and gently pull your head down towards your left shoulder. Then return to centre point.
Repeat, using your right hand pulling towards your right shoulder.

muscleWikiDB.label: Elevated Pike Shoulder Shrug
steps: Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet.
Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key)
Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Silverback Shrug
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the Barbell with both hands in front just past shoulder width.
Bend forward at the hips with a slight bend in your knees, keeping your back straight.
Engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.
Release the shrug.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable 30 Degree Shrug
steps: Use a handle attachment on both sides of crossover. With cable attachment set all the way to the bottom.
Grab both handles and make sure you are centered in the machine. Let your arms hang freely.
Pull your shoulder blades up and in towards your ears. Let your shoulder blades depress back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Shrug
steps: Place the band under your feet. Stand upright.
Elevate your shoulder blades and then depress back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Shrug
steps: Stand tall with two dumbbells. Pull your shoulder blades up. Give a one second squeeze at the top.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Shrug
steps: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with a barbell in front of you.
Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.
Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.
Once the barbell is at your hips, raise your shoulders as high as you can, holding the position for a moment.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Laying 30 Degree Shrug
steps: Lay sideways on a bench letting your arm hang freely.
Pull your shoulder blade and joint toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Overhead Carry
steps: Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a single weight plate overhead with both hands, keeping your arms extended straight above your head.
Begin walking forward, taking slow and steady steps while maintaining a straight line. Your focus should be on maintaining balance and control of the weight plate overhead.

As you walk, continue to keep your arms extended and the weight plate overhead. Try to maintain good posture and avoid leaning forward or backward, as this could result in losing control of the weight plate.
Continue walking for a set distance or for a certain amount of time, keeping your focus on proper form and technique. When finished, return to the starting position and repeat as desired.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Overhead Shrug
steps: Stand tall with a weight plate overhead.
Elevated and depress your scapula.
Avoid leaning forward or backwards to keep pressure off of your lumbar spine.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Incline Shrug
steps: Leaning across the back section of the bench, with feet firmly on the floor and with arms hanging to the sides.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.

muscleWikiDB.label: Elevated Pike Press
steps: Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet.
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.
Repeat

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Upright Row
steps: Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Silverback Shrug
steps: Use a bar attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom.
Stand up with the attachment in hand, walk a couple of steps back make sure you are standing upright and not leaning backwards.
Retract your shoulder blades and then protract to return to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Horizontal Shrug
steps: Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Single Arm Overhead Press
steps: Loop the band under one of your feet. The other end of the bed should be in your hand between your thumb and pointer finger.
Press the band straight up towards the ceiling. Until your elbow is fully extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Upright Row
steps: Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip.
Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the bar to chin level or slightly higher.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Z Press
steps: Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Laying Silverback Shrug
steps: Lay on an incline bench with your arms hanging freely.
Pull your shoulder blades back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Silverback Shrug
steps: Hinge forward slightly at the hips. Make sure to keep a flat back. Let your arms hang in front of you.
Let your scapula protract, and then retract them. Imagine you have a pencil in your mid-back and squeeze it between your shoulder blades.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Y Raise
steps: Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the straps are taut.
Keep both elbows mostly extended and raise both arms out and upwards.
You should make a Y shape with your arms during the back portion of the exercise.

muscleWikiDB.label: Criss Cross Bow Tie Pose
steps: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
Cross your right arm over your left arm, bringing your palms together in front of your chest.
Lower your arms down so that your palms face down towards the ground, and your right elbow is resting on top of your left elbow.
Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides.

muscleWikiDB.label: Eagle Arms Chin Into Chest
steps: Sit cross-legged on the floor and bring your arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
Cross your right arm over your left, bending both elbows so that your forearms are parallel to the floor.
Lift your elbows towards the ceiling and bring your hands together, then drop your chin towards your chest.
Hold for a few breaths, then release your arms and repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Easy Pose Neck Stretch
steps: Begin by sitting cross-legged on the floor.
Slowly drop your chin towards your chest, feeling a stretch in the back of your neck.
Inhale and lift your head up, then exhale and drop your right ear towards your right shoulder.
Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat the stretch.

muscleWikiDB.label: Half Neck Rolls
steps: Sit cross-legged on the floor and interlace your fingers behind your head.
Drop your chin to your chest and roll your head to the right, bringing your right ear towards your right shoulder.
Slowly roll your head back to center, then over to the left so that your left ear is close to your left shoulder.
Repeat the movement from side to side, keeping your shoulders relaxed and breathing deeply.

muscleWikiDB.label: Thread The Needle Hip Over Knees
steps: Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position.
Slide your right knee up between your hands and place your right foot close to your left wrist.
Take your left leg back and lower it down to the ground, keeping your toes tucked.
Twist your torso to the right and reach your right arm underneath your left arm, threading the needle. Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dips narrow elbows
steps: Hold your body at arms length above the equipment
Inhale and slowly lower yourself downward. Keep your elbows close to your body and your torso upright.
Exhale, and using your triceps raise your body back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Seated Overhead Tricep Extension
steps: Sit on the bench and hold a dumbbell with both hands. Raise the dumbbell overhead at arms length, holding the weight up with the palms of your hands.
Keep your elbows in while you lower the weight behind your head, your upper arms stationary.
Raise the weight back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Machine Cable V Bar Push Downs
steps: Grip the pulley bar with palms facing down at shoulder width.
Stand straight with a small forward incline. Keep your upper arms close to your body, and slowly bring the pulley bar down until your arms are fully extended.
Pause when you are at the contracted position of the motion, then slowly raise the pulley bar back to the starting point.

muscleWikiDB.label: Bench Dips
steps: Grip the edge of the bench with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight.
Lower your body straight down.
Slowly press back up to the starting point.
TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Laying Triceps Extensions
steps: Lay on a flat bench while holding a barbell with a shoulder-width grip.
Fully extend your elbows until the barbell is directly over your chest.
Begin to flex your elbows and allow the barbell to nearly touch your forehead.
Extend your elbows back to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Skull Crusher
steps: Lie on your back with knees in the air and soles of your feet flat on the floor.
Hold the kettlebell in both hands directly above your chest.
Keeping your upper arms in place, bend your elbows to slowly bring the kettlebell in front of your forehead.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Standing Tricep Extension
steps: Stand with legs shoulder width apart.
Hold the kettlebell in both hands behind your head.
Straighten arms bringing kettlebell above your head.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Decline Skull Crusher
steps: Lie on the floor with your upper back and soles of feet on the floor, knees bent, and pelvis and lower back suspended in the air.
Hold the kettlebell in both hands directly above your chest.
Keeping your upper arms in place, bend your elbows to bring the kettlebell to the floor above your head.
Return the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Tate Press
steps: Lie flat on your back. Keeping your arm straight, hold the kettlebell above your chest with your palm facing away from your body.
Bend your arm, touching the kettlebell to the top of the shoulder opposite to the arm being worked.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Triceps Stretch Variation Three
steps: Bend your left arm so your hand is at your shoulder, and hold your elbow with the opposite hand.
Gently push on your elbow so it is raised by your head.
Hold the stretch for a few seconds then repeat with the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Triceps Stretch Variation Two
steps: Hold a band so it is in line with your spine. Hold the top with your right hand and the bottom with your left.
Keeping the top still, pull down on the band.
Hold the stretch for a few seconds then repeat with the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Triceps Stretch Variation One
steps: Use the opposite hand to gently apply pressure to the elbow.
Hold the stretch for a few seconds then repeat with the other arm.
Raise your left arm above your head, and bend at the elbow so your hand is resting at the top of your back.

muscleWikiDB.label: Diamond Push Ups
steps: Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape
Use a standard push up position
Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body
Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Close Grip Bench Press
steps: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. With a narrow grip on the bar, straighten your arms
Lower the bar to your lower-mid chest
Slowly raise the bar until you've locked your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Push Down
steps: You can use any attachment for this. The cable should be set all the way at the top of the machine.
Make sure to keep your upper arm glued at your side. Extend your elbows until you feel your triceps contract.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Cross Pushdown
steps: Either use two handles or no attachment at all. Both sides of the cable crossover should be set to the top.
Stand in the center of the machine holding each Cable in the opposing hand. Your upper arm should be at a 45 degree angle with your torso.
Extend your elbows until you feel a contraction and then return to the starting position

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Skullcrusher
steps: You can use a straight bar, rope, easy bar, or two handles. The cable should be set all the way to the top of the machine.
Face away from the machine with your elbows up and the attachment just behind your head.
Extend at the elbows until you feel a contraction in your triceps and then flex at the elbow back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Overhead Tricep Extension
steps: You can use any attachment. The cable should be all the way to the bottom of the machine. Face away from the machine.
Point your elbows straight up toward the ceiling.
From there, extend your elbows until your fists are pointed straight toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Overhead Tricep Extension
steps: Stand with one or both feet on band. Go up and over your head with the band to the starting position.
Flex and extend your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Pushdown
steps: Place the band just above eye level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Push your hips back slightly. Extend and flex at the elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Skullcrusher
steps: Lay flat on the floor or a bench with your fists extended to the ceiling and a neutral grip.
Break at the elbows until your fists are by your temples. Then extend your elbows and flex your triceps at the top.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Skullcrusher
steps: Take a shoulder width grip. Break at the elbows. Try to keep your elbows tucked in. Don't let them flare out.
Stop the bar a few inches from your forehead and extend your elbows back up.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Overhead Tricep Extension
steps: Be careful getting the bar into place overhead. Push your elbows forward while keeping your elbows tucked in.
Look for what feels like a stretch in your triceps. Extend your elbows until your fists are pointed at the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Skullcrusher
steps: Start by lying on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Hold the dumbbells above your chest with your arms extended and your palms facing each other. This is the starting position.
Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your forehead by bending your elbows. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms.
Once the dumbbells are close to your forehead, reverse the motion by extending your elbows and returning to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Rolling Tricep Extension
steps: Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells pointed toward the ceiling.
Break at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps, then flex at the shoulder joint bringing your upper arms to the sides of your head.
Bring your elbows back up until they are pointed at the ceiling, then extend your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Tricep Kickback
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Bend at the waist and place your opposite hand on your knee for support.
From this starting position, extend your arm backwards so that the dumbbell is behind your body.
Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Curl To Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward.
Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body.
Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms.
Lower the plate back behind the head to the starting position of a tricep extension.
Push the plate back up overhead, then lower it back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Overhead Tricep Extension
steps: Stand or sit with a weight plate in your hands, arms extended straight above your head
Lower the weight plate behind your head by bending at the elbows.
Keep your elbows close to your head and shoulders relaxed.
Push the weight plate back up to starting position, extending your arms fully.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Rapunzel Pushdown
steps: Anchor the band to a high point and face away. Hold the band with both hands, placing your hands shoulder-width apart and keeping your elbows close to your body.
Slowly extend your arms downward, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push the band down as far as you can, feeling the contraction in your triceps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
steps: Brace your core and press the weight plate overhead until your arms are fully extended. Keep your shoulders down and back.
While your arms are fully extended, lower the weight behind your head to perform the extension
After completing the extension, lower the weight to your chest, and perform the overhead press. Repeat

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Single Arm Pushdown
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with your right hand, with your arm at your side.
Flex and extend your elbow.

muscleWikiDB.label: Single Arm Rapunzel Pushdown
steps: Stand with a band anchored to a high point. Face away from the band. Hold the loop in one hand.
Keep your elbow tucked in to your side. Extend your elbow. When you extend, don't let your upper arm raise. The band should land over your shoulder.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Single Arm Skullcrusher
steps: Stand facing away from a band which is anchored to a high point.
Keep your elbow pointed forward, and extend and flex your elbow.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Overhead Tricep Extension
steps: Stand tall with a single dumbbell extended overhead.
Flex at the elbow letting the dumbbell travel behind your body.
Try not to let your elbow flare outward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Tate Press
steps: Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells extended toward the ceiling.
Maintain an overhand grip. Flex at the elbows.
The dumbbells will land on your upper chest/clavicle.
Extend your elbows bringing the dumbbells back into their starting position.
*Named after Dave Tate*

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Skullcrusher
steps: Hold the two TRX straps and lean forward. The straps should be over each shoulder.
Keep your elbows tucked in and then flex and extend at the elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dips
steps: Hold your body with arms locked above the equipment
Lower your body slowly while leaning forward, flare out your elbows
Raise your body above the bars until your arms are locked.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Pushup
steps: Loop the band around your mid-back. The ends of the bands should be around your hands between your thumb and pointer finger.
This exercise can be done from the knees or the toes depending on experience level.
Begin by breaking at the elbows until your upper arm is by your side. Then extend at the elbows back into the top position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Floor Press
steps: Un-rack the bar and break at the elbows and shoulders.
Bring your elbows to the floor, rest for a second to remove all the momentum from the rep, then press to a lockout.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Hooklying Bench Press
steps: Start in a bench press position with your feet planted on the bench and knees bent.
Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Larsen Bench Press
steps: Start in a bench press position with your legs elevated. Try to keep your knees with a slight bend in them.
Unrack the bar then initiate the rep.
Bring the bar to your torso and tap your ribcage before pressing back to the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Spoto Press
steps: Start on the bench with your shoulder blades pulled back.
As you initiate the first rep, tuck your elbows slightly until the bar is a few inches off your chest.
Pause just off your chest for 1-3 seconds. Then press explosively.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Z Press
steps: Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Alternating Single Arm Press
steps: Start in a bench press position with two dumbbells.
Break at one of your elbows first while keeping the other elbow extended.
Your working arm should reach your side before pressing back to the ceiling.
Then alternate to the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Bench Press
steps: Lay flat on the bench with your feet on the ground. Raise the dumbbells until you have straight arms.
Lower the dumbbells to your mid chest
Raise the dumbbells until you've locked your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Alternating Single Arm Press
steps: Lay on a decline bench with both arms extended in front of you.
Break at one of your arms first bringing that arm to your side while keeping the other arm extended.
Press the dumbbell back to the ceiling. Fully extend that arm before initiating on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
steps: Lay on a decline bench with both arms extended in front of you.
Break at the elbows and bring your upper arms to your side.
Once your upper arms have reached your side, press the dumbbells back to the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Guillotine Bench Press
steps: Lie on the decline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.
Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Neutral Bench Press
steps: Lie on the decline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.
This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Single Arm Bench Press
steps: Start by laying on a decline bench with two dumbbells.
Position the dumbbell above your chest with your elbow bent and shoulder level.
Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged while the other dumbbell remains pointed toward the ceiling.
Once the dumbbell reaches your side, pause for a moment and then press the weight back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Squeeze Press
steps: Lay flat on a decline bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another.
Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest.
Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Guillotine Bench Press
steps: Lie on the flat bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.
Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Guillotine Incline Bench Press
steps: Lie on the incline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows flared out. As you lower the dumbbells, exhale deeply.
Once your elbows reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
steps: Raise the bench to a 30 - 45 degree angle
Lay on the bench and set your feet on the ground.
Raise the dumbbells with straight arms then slowly lower them to about shoulder width.
Raise them again until your arms are locked and at the starting position again.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Bench Press
steps: Lie on a flat bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.
This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Incline Bench Press
steps: Lie on an incline bench, grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.
This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Seated Overhead Press
steps: Sit on an upright bench , grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your shoulder joint, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.
This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Seated Arnold Press
steps: Begin seated on an upright bench with your palms facing you.
Begin pressing toward the ceiling. As you press, rotate your palms.
As you extend your elbows fully your palms should be facing forward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Squeeze Press
steps: Lay flat on a bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another.
Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest.
Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Press
steps: Start by laying on a bench with two dumbbells.
Position the dumbbell above your chest with your elbow bent and shoulder level.
Slowly lower the dumbbell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged while the other dumbbell remains pointed toward the ceiling.
Once the dumbbell reaches your side, pause for a moment and then press the weight back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Alternating Arnold Press
steps: Start in a standing position

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Alternating Overhead Press
steps: Start with two dumbbells just above your shoulders.
Press one dumbbell to the ceiling while keeping the other in place.
Let the first dumbbell return to its starting position before pressing the other dumbbell.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Alternating Overhead Press
steps: Start with two dumbbells near your shoulders with a neutral grip.
Press one of the dumbbells toward the ceiling while keeping the other in position.
Let the first dumbbell return to its starting position before pressing the other.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Overhead Press
steps: Start with both dumbbells near your shoulders in a neutral grip.
Press the dumbbells toward the ceiling.
Make sure you don't arch your back as you fatigue.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Overhead Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Bring the dumbbells to your shoulders, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
From this starting position, extend your arms upwards so that the dumbbells are overhead.
Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Push Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
From this starting position, dip your knees slightly and then quickly extend them as you press the dumbbells upwards.
Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Arnold Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing you and your elbow bent.
From this starting position, extend your arm upwards so that the dumbbell is directly above your head.
As you extend your arm, rotate your palm to face away from your body.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Neutral Overhead Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing your body and your elbow bent.
From this starting position, press the dumbbell upwards so that it is directly above your shoulder.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Overhead Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing forward and your elbow bent.
From this starting position, extend your arm upwards so that the dumbbell is overhead.
Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat Reach
steps: Stand holding a weight plate at chest height with both hands.
Lower into a squat, extending the plate in front of you at chest height
As you stand back up, pull the plate back into your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat Hold Reach
steps: Hold the plate with both hands at chest height.
Keeping your core tight and your chest up, squat down as low as you can go while keeping your feet flat on the ground.
Hold the squat position and reach the plate forward, keeping your arms straight and your back straight.
Return the plate to your chest while you hold the squat position and repeat reaching the plate in front of you

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Reverse Lunge Twist
steps: Step back with your right foot into a lunge position, both knees bent at 90 degrees.
Twist your torso to the right, keeping the plate close to your chest.
Push through your front foot to return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Deficit Pushup
steps: Start in a pushup position with both hands on a plate. This will extend your range of motion.
Break at the elbows and shoulders until your upper arm travels behind the body slightly.
Then press back into the original position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Elevated Pushup
steps: Start by placing two dumbbells on the floor, about shoulder-width apart.
Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the dumbbells, keeping your arms straight.
Keep your feet together, with your toes resting on the floor.
Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the dumbbells.
Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Pushup
steps: Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them.
Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders.
Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line.
Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Child Pose Elbows On Block
steps: Place two blocks on the floor, shoulder-width apart.
Kneel in front of the blocks, and lower your torso down so that your elbows are resting on the blocks, and your forehead is resting on the floor.
Relax your arms, shoulders, and neck, and breathe deeply.
Hold for a few breaths, then release.

muscleWikiDB.label: One Arm Cow Face Pose
steps: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
Bend your left knee and place your left foot on the floor, close to your right hip.
Cross your right leg over your left leg, stacking your knees on top of each other.
Bring your left arm up overhead, and bend your elbow so that your left hand reaches towards your upper back. Reach your right hand behind your back and try to clasp your left hand. Hold

muscleWikiDB.label: Pyramid Prayer
steps: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place your hands on a table, chair, or any elevated surface in front of you.
Walk your feet back until your torso is parallel to the ground, and your elbows are resting on the surface.
Relax your head and neck, and breathe deeply.
Hold for a few breaths, then release.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
steps: Stand up straight with dumbbells at either side, palms facing your hips.
Raise your arms on either side with a slight bend in your elbow until they are parallel with the floor. Pause at the top of the motion.
Slowly return your arms down to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Rear Delt Fly
steps: With dumbbells in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Arch your back above your knees, and start with the weights touching in front of your chest.
With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion.
Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Machine Face Pulls
steps: Facing the pulley, pull the weight towards you while keeping your arms parallel to the ground.
Pull your hands back to both sides of your head and hold the position.
Slowly return weight to starting position. Repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Seated Overhead Press
steps: Sit on a bench with back support. Raise the dumbbells to shoulder height with your palms forward.
Raise the dumbbells upwards and pause at the contracted position.
Lower the weights back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Front Raise
steps: Grab two dumbbells while standing upright with the dumbbells at your side.
Raise the two dumbbells with your elbows being fully extended until the dumbbells are eye level.
Lower the weights in a controlled manner to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Seated Rear Delt Fly
steps: With dumbbells in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Arch your back above your knees, and start with the weights touching in front of your chest.
With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion.
Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Rear Delt Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your upper chest and then lower the kettlebell- repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Front Raise
steps: Stand up straight with feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell in front of your pelvis.
Keeping arms straight, raise the kettlebell slightly higher than head level.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Single Arm Rear Delt Fly
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Bring one arm behind you and rest this arm on your back. With the other arm, hold the kettlebell at arms length close to the floor.
Swing the kettlebell out and up towards the side of your body and then return to centre. Repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Long Lever Lateral Raise
steps: Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a kettlebell with one hand at your side.
Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell up and out, away from your body to around head height, holding on to the kettlebell firmly so it does not change position in your hand.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Single Arm Lateral Raise
steps: Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a kettlebell with one hand at your side.
Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell up and out, away from your body to around head height.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Shoulders Stretch Variation Four
steps: Stand with you feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand.
Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.
Repeat with your other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Shoulders Stretch Variation Three
steps: Place the top of your hand into the small of your back, your arm at a 90 degree angle.
Hold your elbow with the other arm, and slowly pull the arm forward until you feel your shoulder engaged in the stretch. Pause at the apex of the stretch and return to the starting position.
Return to starting position, and repeat with your other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Shoulders Stretch Variation Two
steps: Start with your arms at either side. Begin by pushing your shoulders forward and in towards your chest.
Repeat as necessary.
Continue the circular motion with your shoulders, pinching up towards your ears, and then extending your chest outwards while you finish the motion.

muscleWikiDB.label: Shoulders Stretch Variation One
steps: Reach one arm behind your body, with your elbow pointing upward behind your head.
Assist the stretch with your other hand on your elbow to engage your shoulder.
Pause for a few seconds, then repeat the stretch with your other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Elevated Pike Press
steps: Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet.
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.
Repeat

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Overhead Press
steps: Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine. Stand upright making sure to maintain a flat back. Your starting position will have your palms facing forward.
Use both your elbows and shoulders to press the weight directly overhead.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Lateral Raise
steps: Use a handle attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
You should vertically abduct at the shoulder raising your arm straight out to the side.
Raise until your arm is parallel with the ground and then back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Rear Delt Fly
steps: Use a handle attachment or no attachment at all. The cable should be set to the top.
Walk a few steps away with the cable coming from the opposing side of the working arm.
From there, your shoulders should horizontally abduct and adduct, while your elbows stay in a fixed position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Upright Row
steps: Use a handle attachment with the cable set to the bottom of the machine.
Pull your elbows straight up toward the ceiling until the attachment is just below your chin then extend until your elbows are fully extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Face Pull
steps: Anchor the band at eye level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Use an overhand grip with both hands. Pull the band to the bridge of your nose flaring your elbows out.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Front Raise
steps: Stand on the band with one or 2 feet depending on how heavy you want the band to be.
With your elbows extended raise your fists straight up to the ceiling until they are at eye level.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Lateral Raise
steps: Grab the band at shoulder width. Raise your arms straight out to the side.
The band should scrape against your shirt.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Pull Apart
steps: Grab the band with a shoulder width grip. Point your arms straight in front of you.
Retract your shoulder blades and shoulder joint until the band taps your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Single Arm Overhead Press
steps: Loop the band under one of your feet. The other end of the bed should be in your hand between your thumb and pointer finger.
Press the band straight up towards the ceiling. Until your elbow is fully extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Front Raise
steps: Stand tall with an overhand grip on the barbell. Raise your arms until your fists are around eye level.
Return to the start under control. This exercise is prone to using momentum when you begin to fatigue.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Overhead Press
steps: Take a roughly shoulder width grip. There should be a straight line from your elbow to fist (vertical forearms).
Pull your chin back and press the weight toward the ceiling by extending at the elbow joint and flexing at the shoulder joint.
Press until your elbows are extended and push your head forward slightly.
Return to the start position with control. Pulling your chin back to allow the bar to pass your face safely.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Upright Row
steps: Take a double overhand roughly shoulder width grip.
Pull your elbows straight up the ceiling. Aim to get the bar to chin level or slightly higher.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Rear Delt Row
steps: Hinge forward at the hips while maintaining a flat back. Try to get your torso as close to parallel with the ground as your mobility will allow for.
Let your arms hang in front of you. Pull your elbows back towards the ceiling while flaring your elbows outward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Z Press
steps: Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs extended and a barbell in your hands, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, lift the barbell up from your chest and press it straight up above your head.
Lower the barbell back down to your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Bayesian Lateral Raise
steps: Lay on an incline bench and let your arms freely.
Lateral raise your arms straight out to the side until your arms are about parallel with the ground.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Laying Reverse Fly
steps: With dumbbells in either hand, lay on an incline bench that's at about 15-30 degrees.
With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion.
Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Laying Reverse Fly Internally Rotated
steps: With dumbbells in either hand and an overhand grip, lay on an incline bench that is roughly 15 - 30 degrees high.
With bent elbows, raise your arms up to shoulder level, pausing at the at the end of the motion.
Slowly lower your arms back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Seated Overhead Press
steps: Sit on an upright bench , grasp a pair of dumbbells and hold them at shoulder level with your palms facing each other. Keep your elbows bent and close to your body.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to your shoulder joint, keeping your elbows bent and close to your body.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, pause for a moment and then press them back up to the starting position.
This variation is much easier on the shoulder joints.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Seated Arnold Press
steps: Begin seated on an upright bench with your palms facing you.
Begin pressing toward the ceiling. As you press, rotate your palms.
As you extend your elbows fully your palms should be facing forward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Alternating Arnold Press
steps: Start in a standing position

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Alternating Overhead Press
steps: Start with two dumbbells just above your shoulders.
Press one dumbbell to the ceiling while keeping the other in place.
Let the first dumbbell return to its starting position before pressing the other dumbbell.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Arnold Press
steps: Stand with both palms facing you.
Begin to press the dumbbells to the ceiling while rotating your palms.
When you reach elbow extension, your palms should be facing forward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Alternating Overhead Press
steps: Start with two dumbbells near your shoulders with a neutral grip.
Press one of the dumbbells toward the ceiling while keeping the other in position.
Let the first dumbbell return to its starting position before pressing the other.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Neutral Overhead Press
steps: Start with both dumbbells near your shoulders in a neutral grip.
Press the dumbbells toward the ceiling.
Make sure you don't arch your back as you fatigue.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Overhead Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Bring the dumbbells to your shoulders, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
From this starting position, extend your arms upwards so that the dumbbells are overhead.
Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Push Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
From this starting position, dip your knees slightly and then quickly extend them as you press the dumbbells upwards.
Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Arnold Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing you and your elbow bent.
From this starting position, extend your arm upwards so that the dumbbell is directly above your head.
As you extend your arm, rotate your palm to face away from your body.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Neutral Overhead Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing your body and your elbow bent.
From this starting position, press the dumbbell upwards so that it is directly above your shoulder.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Overhead Press
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder, with your palm facing forward and your elbow bent.
From this starting position, extend your arm upwards so that the dumbbell is overhead.
Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Car Driver
steps: Inhale and brace your abdominals
Raise the arms vertically while keeping the elbows slightly bent
Once the arms are parallel with the floor, rotate the plate clockwise and counterclockwise.
Lower the plate back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Front Raise
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing the thighs.
Keeping the elbows slightly bent, lift the plate up to the front of the body.
Raise the plate up until the arms are fully extended, maintaining control of the plate.
Lower the plate back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Halo
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate held in front of your face with both hands, palms facing each other.
Rotate the plate around the head, keeping the arms extended and moving the plate in a circular motion.
Complete one full circle, then reverse the direction to complete another circle.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band High Face Pull
steps: Start with a band anchored to a high point. Stagger your stance.
Pull the band to the bridge of your nose.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Low Lateral Raise
steps: Anchor a band to a low point and stand with the band crossing your body.
While keeping your elbow mostly extended, lift your arm until it's parallel with the floor.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Mid Lateral Raise
steps: Anchor a band to a point that is the same height as your fist when your arms are at your side and stand with the band crossing your body.
While keeping your elbow mostly extended, lift your arm until it's parallel with the floor.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Overhead Press
steps: Stand between the two anchored bands, grasp them with an overhand grip, and position the bands at shoulder level.
Brace your core and push the bands overhead, fully extending your arms.
Lower the bands back to shoulder level, keeping your core engaged and arms straight. Repeat for desired number of reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Rear Delt Fly
steps: Start by standing between the two anchored bands with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bands positioned at a high point.
Grasp the ends of each band with your hands, keeping your palms facing each other.

Keeping your arms slightly bent and your back straight, slowly pull the bands away from your body until your arms are extended straight out to the sides. Hold for a second, then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Full Lateral Raise
steps: Stand tall holding two plates at your side.
Lateral raise the plates to your side and continue until the plates are pointed at the ceiling.
Let your shoulder joint naturally rotate. At the bottom you should have a neutral or overhand grip. By the time the plates are overhead, your palms should be facing forward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Internally Rotated Rear Delt Fly
steps: With plates in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Hinge forward with a flat back.
Maintain an overhand grip and internally rotated shoulders.
Raise your arms backward toward the ceiling while maintaining a light band in your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Lateral Raise
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grip two plates in each hand at your sides.
Keeping your arms straight, raise the plates out to your sides until they are in line with your shoulders.
Lower the plates back to your sides with control. Repeat for desired number of reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Rear Delt Fly
steps: Keep your back straight and bend forward slightly at the waist.
With arms extended, raise the weights out to your sides until they are in line with your shoulders.
Pause briefly and then lower the weights back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Reach
steps: Start in a standing position with a plate against your chest.
Press the plate away from your body until your elbows are extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Laying Lateral Raise
steps: Lay on your side on a bench or box. Place one hand on the floor and the other hand is holding the dumbbell.
While keeping your elbow mostly extended, raise the dumbbell to the side.
The end of the range of motion is when the dumbbell is pointed toward the ceiling.
Make sure you don't flex and extend your elbow.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Single Arm Upright Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand with an overhand grip.
Keep your back straight and chest lifted, engage your core to maintain balance.
Begin the movement by lifting the dumbbell straight up towards your chin, keeping your elbow close to your body and the weight in line with your shoulder.
Continue to lift the weight until it reaches the chin or neck level, keeping the elbow high and close to the body.
Lower the weight back down to the starting position with control.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Upright Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding 2 dumbbells in each hand.
Keep your back straight and chest lifted, engage your core to maintain balance.
Begin the movement by lifting the dumbbells straight up towards your chin, keeping your elbow close to your body and the weight in line with your shoulder.
Continue to lift the weight until it reaches the chin or neck level, keeping the elbow high and close to the body.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX I Raise
steps: Stand facing the TRX straps and hold onto the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Keeping your core engaged, slowly raise your arms forward until they are overhead.
Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Rear Delt Fly
steps: Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands.
Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Rear Delt Row
steps: Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands.
Step away so your body is leaning away from the anchor point.
Flex your elbows and pull your elbows straight back behind your body.
Make sure to keep your elbows flared outward.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX W Raise
steps: Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point.
Pull your elbows back while externally rotating your shoulder joint. Your arms should make a W shape at the back portion of the exercise.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Y Raise
steps: Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the straps are taut.
Keep both elbows mostly extended and raise both arms out and upwards.
You should make a Y shape with your arms during the back portion of the exercise.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Squat Hold Reach
steps: Hold the plate with both hands at chest height.
Keeping your core tight and your chest up, squat down as low as you can go while keeping your feet flat on the ground.
Hold the squat position and reach the plate forward, keeping your arms straight and your back straight.
Return the plate to your chest while you hold the squat position and repeat reaching the plate in front of you

muscleWikiDB.label: Elevated Pike Shoulder Shrug
steps: Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet.
Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key)
Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Horizontal Shrug
steps: Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Alternating Single Arm Press
steps: Start in a bench press position with two dumbbells.
Break at one of your elbows first while keeping the other elbow extended.
Your working arm should reach your side before pressing back to the ceiling.
Then alternate to the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Decline Squeeze Press
steps: Lay flat on a decline bench with two dumbbells pressed to one another.
Break at the elbows and keep your elbows tucked as you bring the dumbbells to your chest.
Continue to press the dumbbells into one another throughout the rep.
Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Thruster
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Bring the dumbbells to your shoulders, with your palms facing inward and your elbows bent.
From this starting position, dip your knees slightly and then quickly extend them as you press the dumbbells upwards.
As you press the dumbbells upwards, also push your hips forward to help generate additional power.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Clean And Press
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the feet.
Bend the knees and hips to pick up the plate, keeping the back straight and core engaged.
Stand up, lock the hips and legs, and press the plate overhead with straight arms.
Lower the plate back to the starting position, keeping control of it, and repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Curl To Overhead Press
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward.
Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body.
Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms.
Lower the plate back to the starting position, keeping control of it, and repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Curl To Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward.
Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body.
Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms.
Lower the plate back behind the head to the starting position of a tricep extension.
Push the plate back up overhead, then lower it back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
steps: Brace your core and press the weight plate overhead until your arms are fully extended. Keep your shoulders down and back.
While your arms are fully extended, lower the weight behind your head to perform the extension
After completing the extension, lower the weight to your chest, and perform the overhead press. Repeat

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Overhead Carry
steps: Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a single weight plate overhead with both hands, keeping your arms extended straight above your head.
Begin walking forward, taking slow and steady steps while maintaining a straight line. Your focus should be on maintaining balance and control of the weight plate overhead.

As you walk, continue to keep your arms extended and the weight plate overhead. Try to maintain good posture and avoid leaning forward or backward, as this could result in losing control of the weight plate.
Continue walking for a set distance or for a certain amount of time, keeping your focus on proper form and technique. When finished, return to the starting position and repeat as desired.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Thruster
steps: Start with the plate at chest height. Begin a squat.
Make sure to hit parallel depth. On your way back up, use the momentum you generate with your legs to help push the plate into an overhead position.
Let the plate return to chest height before initiating the next squat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Overhead Squat
steps: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold two dumbbells overhead with both hands, using an overhand grip.
Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead.
Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plank IYTW
steps: Start in a plank position. Hold one dumbbell.
Raise the dumbbell straight out in front of you (I), at a 45 degree angle (Y), out to the side (T), and then bend at the elbow while raising (W).
Going through IYTW counts as one rep.
Make sure to keep your hips stable. If you're unable to, try performing this exercise from the knees.

muscleWikiDB.label: Single Arm Overhead Squat
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in your right hand, extending it overhead.
Inhale and begin to squat down, keeping the dumbbell overhead and your back straight.
Go down as far as you can while still maintaining control, then exhale and return to standing position, keeping the dumbbell overhead. Repeat for desired reps and then switch to the other arm.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Pushup
steps: Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them.
Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders.
Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line.
Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

muscleWikiDB.label: Eagle Arm Pose
steps: Begin seated or standing with your arms at your sides.
Inhale and reach your arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
Cross your right arm over your left arm, bringing your palms to touch if possible.
Hold for a few breaths and then release the arms and repeat with the left arm over the right.

muscleWikiDB.label: Wide Legged Forward Fall
steps: Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart.
Interlace your fingers behind your back and inhale to expand your chest.
Exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands up and over your head towards the ground.
Hold for a few breaths and then release the hands and come back up to standing.

muscleWikiDB.label: Puppy Pose
steps: Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground.
Walk your hands forward as you lower your chest towards the ground.
Keep your hips over your knees and extend your arms out in front of you.
Hold for a few breaths and then release.

muscleWikiDB.label: Reverse Prayer
steps: Start seated or standing with your arms at your sides.
Bring your hands behind your back and interlace your fingers with your palms facing up.
Inhale and draw your shoulder blades together, lifting your chest.
Exhale and gently press your hands down towards the floor as you continue to lift your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Reverse Prayer Variation
steps: Stand with a straight back and tall Chest
Bring your hands behind your back, making fists
Bring your two fists together in the center of your back

muscleWikiDB.label: Headstand
steps: Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
Place your forearms on the floor and interlace your fingers.
Place the crown of your head on the floor and tuck your toes under.
Walk your feet towards your head and lift your hips up.
Straighten your legs and find your balance. Hold for several breaths and then release.

muscleWikiDB.label: Machine Pulldown
steps: Grip the bar with the palms facing forward, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance wider than shoulder width.
As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar, bring your torso back around 30 degrees while sticking your chest out.
Pull the bar down to about chin level or a little lower in a smooth movement whilst squeezing the shoulder blades together.
After a second of squeezing, slowly raise the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Machine Seated Cable Row
steps: Sit with your back straight on the machine and grip the handles.
Pull the handles back using your arms. Your legs and torso should be at a 90 angle. Push out your chest.
Pull the handles towards your body until your hands are beside your abdomen.

muscleWikiDB.label: Pull Ups
steps: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended.
Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.
Lower your body back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Row Bilateral
steps: Grab both dumbbells and hinge forward at the hips. Make sure you keep a flat back.
The closer your torso is to parallel with the ground the longer the range of motion will be at your shoulder. The better the results you'll get from the exercise.
Let your arms hang freely, and then pull your elbow joint straight back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Bent Over Row
steps: Grab a barbell with a shoulder width pronated or supinated grip.
Bend forward at your hips while maintaining a flat back.
Pull the weight toward your upper abdomen.
Lower the weight in a controlled manner and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Shoulder Extension
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart bending forward at the hips as far as comfortable. Place off-hand on the same side thigh for stability.
Hold the kettlebell in one hand, straight armed and pointing towards the floor.
Keeping your arm straight, swing the kettlebell behind you as far as comfortable.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Single Arm Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, shifting one foot behind you. Hold the kettlebell in the same hand as the leg shifted backwards.
Bend forwards at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knee, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Pullover
