steps: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Deadlift
steps: Stand with your mid-foot under the bar and grip the bar with your hands, about a shoulder width apart.
Bend your knees, then lift the bar by straightening your back. It is important to keep your back straight.
Stand to your full height and hold.
Lower the bar to the floor by bending your knees and keeping your back straight.

muscleWikiDB.label: Machine Seated Cable Row
steps: Sit with your back straight on the machine and grip the handles.
Pull the handles back using your arms. Your legs and torso should be at a 90 angle. Push out your chest.
Pull the handles towards your body until your hands are beside your abdomen.

muscleWikiDB.label: Pull Ups
steps: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended.
Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.
Lower your body back to starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Row Bilateral
steps: Grab both dumbbells and hinge forward at the hips. Make sure you keep a flat back.
The closer your torso is to parallel with the ground the longer the range of motion will be at your shoulder. The better the results you'll get from the exercise.
Let your arms hang freely, and then pull your elbow joint straight back toward the ceiling.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Deadlift
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Return to standing position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Row
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Silverback Shrug
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.

muscleWikiDB.label: Inverted Row
steps: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Pull your body straight up to the bar.
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Elevated Pike Press
steps: Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet.
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.
Repeat

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Pull Apart
steps: Grab the band with a shoulder width grip. Point your arms straight in front of you.
Retract your shoulder blades and shoulder joint until the band taps your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Row Unilateral
steps: Brace your off arm against something stable (bench, box). Stagger your stance so your leg on the side of your working arm is back.
Try to get your torso to parallel with the ground. That will extend your range of motion.
Let your arm hang freely and then pull your elbow back. Imagine you've got a tennis ball in your armpit and squeeze it each rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Rear Delt Row
steps: Hinge forward at the hips while maintaining a flat back. Try to get your torso as close to parallel with the ground as your mobility will allow for.
Let your arms hang in front of you. Pull your elbows back towards the ceiling while flaring your elbows outward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band High Face Pull
steps: Start with a band anchored to a high point. Stagger your stance.
Pull the band to the bridge of your nose.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Rear Delt Fly
steps: Start by standing between the two anchored bands with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bands positioned at a high point.
Grasp the ends of each band with your hands, keeping your palms facing each other.

Keeping your arms slightly bent and your back straight, slowly pull the bands away from your body until your arms are extended straight out to the sides. Hold for a second, then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Internally Rotated Rear Delt Fly
steps: With plates in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Hinge forward with a flat back.
Maintain an overhand grip and internally rotated shoulders.
Raise your arms backward toward the ceiling while maintaining a light band in your elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Rear Delt Fly
steps: Keep your back straight and bend forward slightly at the waist.
With arms extended, raise the weights out to your sides until they are in line with your shoulders.
Pause briefly and then lower the weights back to the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Rear Delt Fly
steps: Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands.
Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Rear Delt Row
steps: Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands.
Step away so your body is leaning away from the anchor point.
Flex your elbows and pull your elbows straight back behind your body.
Make sure to keep your elbows flared outward.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX W Raise
steps: Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point.
Pull your elbows back while externally rotating your shoulder joint. Your arms should make a W shape at the back portion of the exercise.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cat Pose
steps: Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
Inhale and arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling, while lowering your belly towards the floor.
Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin towards your chest, and bringing your tailbone towards your knees.
Repeat these movements, flowing smoothly between the two poses, for several breaths.

muscleWikiDB.label: Easy Seated Twist Pose
steps: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you.
Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you.
Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh.
Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh.
Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling.
Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling.
Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.
Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands
steps: Begin in Warrior II pose, with your right foot forward and your left foot back.
Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart.
Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee.
Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands Beginner
steps: Begin in a low lunge position with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground.
Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart.
Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee.
Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Seated Twist
steps: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you.
Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh.
Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling.
Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Landmine Side Bend
steps: Stand straight and hold the end of the Barbell
Keep your hips and shoulders facing forward, bend to one side slowly
Return to the upright position.
Switch hands and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Wood Chopper
steps: Stand with a shoulder width stance. Begin with the dumbbell near one of your quads.
Rotate at your upper spine to engage the obliques.
You can pivot your back foot to keep from generating too much torque at the knee.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Wood Chopper
steps: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart and hold the kettle bell with both hands against your hip.
Keeping your arms straight, swing the kettlebell upwards and across your body towards your shoulder, raising the kettlebell to head height rotating your hips as you do so.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Wood Chopper
steps: Set the cable at about nipple level. Use a handle attachment.
Face sideways, then rotate your torso with your arms extended against the resistance.
After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Russian Twist
steps: Sit on the floor and flex your knees and hips to a 90 degree angle.
Your feet should be hovering off the ground. (If that's too hard start with heels on the floor)
Rotate your upper spine to engage your obliques.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Russian Twist
steps: Sit on the floor with your legs bent, knees together and feet raised slightly off the floor.

Starting on one side and sitting up straight with your core muscles engaged, lift the kettlebell off the floor with both hands and bring it across your body to the other side, rotating your chest towards the floor as you do so.
Tap the kettlebell lightly on the floor and bring the kettlebell back across your body to the starting position, rotating your chest towards the floor.
Repeat, keeping the legs bent and feet raised throughout the exercise.

muscleWikiDB.label: Band Pallof Press
steps: Place the band at an anchor point that is shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Start with your fingers interlocked around the band and your fists connected to your chest.
Extend at the elbows pressing the band away from your body until your elbows are fully extended.

muscleWikiDB.label: Kettlebell Windmill
steps: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Hold the kettlebell in one hand and extend your arm above your head.
Keeping your legs straight and the kettlebell above your head, lower the relaxed arm towards the ground, twisting your body towards the side of the raised arm.
Return to the starting potion, tilt your pelvis forward and repeat.

muscleWikiDB.label: Cable Pallof Press
steps: Use a handle attachment, set the cable at nipple level, walk a few steps away, and face sideways.
Start with both hands on the handle and your fists against your chest.
Press the handle forward until your elbows are fully extended, then pull the handle back to your chest.

muscleWikiDB.label: Abdominals Stretch Variation Three
steps: Reach up with your left arm and then lean slowly to the right. Lean until a stretch is felt in the obliques.
Stand upright.
After completing the desired amount of reps with the left arm, switch to the right arm and lean to the left.

muscleWikiDB.label: Abdominals Stretch Variation Two
steps: Stand upright.
Reach with both hands upwards until you can interlock your fingers.
With your hands above your head, lean back until a stretch is felt in the abdominals.

muscleWikiDB.label: Bodyweight Russian Twist
steps: Hover your heels just off the ground.
Stick your chest out and maintain a flat back. Make all the movement happen at your mid and upper spine.
Point your chest to the left, then rotate at the spine until your chest is pointed right.

muscleWikiDB.label: Side Plank Up Down
steps: Start with your elbow and hip on the ground. Either neutral fist or flat hand on the ground.
Begin in a side plank position, and then drop your hips to the floor.
Pull your hips back to the ceiling to finish the rep.

muscleWikiDB.label: Side Plank Reach Through
steps: Begin in an elbow side plank position.
Reach for the ceiling with your off hand.
Rotate at the mid and upper spine and reach through the open space between the floor and your torso.
Reach backwards, and then rotate back into the starting position.

muscleWikiDB.label: Elbow Side Plank
steps: Press your elbow into the floor.
Pick your hips up off the ground and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time.
Make sure you don't let your chest fall forward or backward.

muscleWikiDB.label: Hand Side Plank
steps: Press your hand into the ground and pick up your hip off the ground.
Open your chest and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time.

muscleWikiDB.label: Barbell Suitcase Deadlift
steps: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a barbell at one side of your body, with your palms facing your thighs.
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and knees to lower the barbell down towards the ground.
As the barbell reaches the ground, use your legs and glutes to push through your heels and extend your hips and knees to raise your body back to the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with the barbell on the opposite side of your body.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Wood Chopper
steps: Take a half kneeling position. Start with the dumbbell by your knee on the side of the kneeling leg.
Rotate at the upper spine, holding the dumbbell away from your body with nearly extended elbows.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Kneeling Wood Chopper
steps: Start in a kneeling position with your shoulder blades pulled back.
The dumbbell should begin by one of your hips.
Rotate at the spine and bring the dumbbell from your hip, 180 degrees around your body. The dumbbell should land at eye level.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Overhead Side Bend
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell overhead.
From this starting position, bend to the side as far as you can while keeping your feet planted and your core engaged.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Side Plank Up Down
steps: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and a dumbbell on your hip.
Place your bottom elbow on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground.
Your hips will do all the moving. Think, "hips up, hips down."

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Hand Side Plank
steps: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and a dumbbell on your hip.
Place your bottom hand on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground.
From this starting position, hold the side plank position for the desired amount of time, making sure to keep your body straight and your hips level.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Russian Twist
steps: Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground
Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button toward your spine.
Slowly twist your upper body to the right, keeping your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
Hold for a second and then twist to the left, holding for another second.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Standing Twist
steps: Stand with a plate extended away from your body. Elbows mostly extended.
Rotate at the upper spine while keeping your lumbar spine in a neutral position.
Do not let the plate go behind your body.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Wood Chopper
steps: Stand with a shoulder width stance. Begin with the plate near one of your quads.
Rotate at your upper spine to engage the obliques.
You can pivot your back foot to keep from generating too much torque at the knee.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Long Lever Russian Twist
steps: Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Hold a dumbbell in both hands with your arms extended straight in front of you.
Twist your torso to the right, bringing the dumbbell towards the ground, then return to the center. Repeat on the left side, twisting to the left and bringing the dumbbell towards the ground.
Continue this twisting motion, alternating sides, for the desired number of repetitions. Keep your core engaged and avoid swinging your arms to generate momentum.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Side Bend
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart and place your right hand on the right hip.
Hold a dumbbell with the left hand. Bend at the hips to the side.
Make sure you don't start to lean forward to try and force a longer range of motion.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Forearm Side Plank
steps: Lie on your side with your legs straight and your feet resting in the TRX foot cradles.
Prop yourself up on your forearm and engage your core to maintain a straight line from your head to your feet.

muscleWikiDB.label: TRX Oblique Crunch
steps: Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position.
Pull both knees to your right elbow.
Extend your legs back to the starting position, then pull both knees to the left elbow.

muscleWikiDB.label: Dumbbell Offset Squat
steps: Hold a dumbbell over one shoulder.
Initiate the squat by pushing your hips back.
Avoid doing any twisting. Try to keep your shoulders even.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Reverse Lunge Twist
steps: Step back with your right foot into a lunge position, both knees bent at 90 degrees.
Twist your torso to the right, keeping the plate close to your chest.
Push through your front foot to return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Plate Pinch Grip Side Bend
steps: Stand straight with the plate held at your side
Keep your hips and shoulders facing forward, bend to one side slowly
Return to the upright position.
Switch hands and repeat

muscleWikiDB.label: Gate Pose Variation Arm Extended on Side
steps: Start on your knees and extend your right leg out to the side.
Raise your right arm above your head and reach towards the left side of the room.
Gently bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on your left thigh.
Look up towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

muscleWikiDB.label: Revolved Head To Knee
steps: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
Bend your right knee and bring your heel towards your perineum.
Place your left hand on the outside of your right knee and twist your body to the right.
Reach your right hand towards your left foot and look up towards the ceiling. Hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

muscleWikiDB.label: Seated Side Bend Pose
steps: Sit comfortably on the floor with your legs crossed.
Inhale and raise your right arm above your head.
As you exhale, bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on the ground.
Look up towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths. Then switch sides and repeat the pose on the other side.

muscleWikiDB.label: Supine Twist Lying
steps: Lie down on your back with your arms stretched out to your sides.
Bend your right knee and bring it towards your chest.
Slowly twist your body to the left side, bringing your right knee across your body towards the ground on the left side.
Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

muscleWikiDB.label: Wild Thing Pose
steps: Start in a downward facing dog position.
Shift your weight onto your left hand and foot, and lift your right leg towards the ceiling.
Slowly bend your right knee and shift your weight onto your right hand as you open up your chest towards the ceiling.
Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.
